SENT.plain: Although systemic immune reactivity to 65-kD mycobacterial hsp65 (m-hsp65) has been shown previously in BehÃ§et's disease (BD), local immune response was not investigated

We studied anti-m-hsp65 IgG, IgM and IgA antibodies in the serum and cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) of 25 BD patients with cerebral parenchymal involvement (p-NBD), seven BD patients with intracranial hypertension (ih-NBD), eight BD patients without central nervous system (CNS) involvement, 30 patients with multiple sclerosis (MS) and 24 patients with non-inflammatory CNS disorders (NIC)
Significantly higher CSF IgG responses were detected in p-NBD patients (ELISA ratio 1.3 +/- 0.9) compared with NIC (0.7 +/- 0.4, P < 0.01)
In p-NBD patients' IgG, IgM or IgA CSF anti-m-hsp65 positivity rate was 48% (12/25); this was significantly higher when compared with MS (3/30; P < 0.03) and NIC (3/24; P < 0.01)
CSF anti-m-hsp65 IgG ratios correlated with the duration of BD (r = 0.4, P < 0.04) but not with the duration of neurological involvement
Serum IgM and IgA responses were elevated in ih-NBD, suggesting a different type of involvement than p-NBD
These results implicate an increased local humoral response to m-hsp65 in the CSF of p-NBD patients, which might be related to the pathogenesis of neurological involvement
